keyword: how many calories in a bottle wine
title: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a bottle wine (standard 750 ml), including carbs, alcohol impact, and variations for red, white, or sweet types.
h1: How Many Calories in a Bottle of Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry red or white wine, 12-13% ABV, no added sugars or fortification.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, alcohol content, brand, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry wine contains about 638 calories, mostly from alcohol and residual sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: About 638 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine.

faqs.q: What's the calorie count for white wine per bottle?
faqs.a: Similar to red, around 638 kcal for 750 ml dry white.

faqs.q: Do all wines have the same calories per bottle?
faqs.a: Noâ€”sweet wines can reach 800+ kcal; dry ones are lower.

faqs.q: How many calories in one glass from a bottle of wine?
faqs.a: About 125 kcal per 150 ml glass (5 glasses per standard bottle).

faqs.q: Why are calories in wine mostly from alcohol?
faqs.a: Alcohol provides 7 kcal per gram; a 750 ml bottle has ~60 g alcohol.
